Why a technical blog?
Starting a technical blog is a commitment. Many do quite well in the beginning and then fade slowly away. Many times I find an interesting article for a specific topic on Google and then realize that this blog entry was from years ago. It is still relevant and I wonder what happened to the author.
Book - Erlang and Elixir for imperative programmers
Last year I started developing an application that needs a very reliable, fast and error resilient web service. Once I knew the requirements I also knew the technology: Erlang. What is good enough for a telecommunication router should be more than enough for my service.
Book - Personal History of Programming Languages
After more than 30 years programming I am looking back at all the programming languages I have (or had to) use.
Microsoft Azure and Powershell
Jun 2015 Many developers who are using Azure do not use Powershell. This article looks into the possibilities.
Testing with Karma and Typescript
Jun 2015 Karma is a test runner for JavaScript tests. We show how it can be used for Typescript programs as well.
Windows 10 - Second Look
Jan 2016 A few weeks ago I wrote about my first impressions of Windows 10 Windows 10 - First Look. Now I had more time to work with it and here are my findings.
UI Framework Choices
Oct 2015 I had to choose a UI framework for a few web applications that will be built from now until Q1 of next year. The question is: What is the offer and which framework will be around in a year?.
MongoDB's hidden feature - GridFS
Jun 2015 One of the features of MongoDB is GridFS, a specialized collection for binary files. There is not much discussion about this feature and it seems that GridFS is not used widely.

(updated: Jan 2016)
 Windows 10 finally arrived on my developer machine. Read here about the first impressions with the “RTM” version. Of course, Microsoft tries to convince us that there are only update versions and no RTM version.
Akka.net Experiences
Jul 2015 The actor model is the new cool in the .Net world. The concept as such is more than 40 years old and on other platforms there are actor model implementations widely used.
The Future of Web Applications
Jun 2015 Have pure web applications a future in view of mobile apps? Let’s investigate.
Programming Myths
Jul 2015 Coming to a new project and analyzing the existing solution and code base, I try to question some design decisions and often hear: “It must be done like this.”

(updated: Jun 2015)

Time with Aurelia
May 2015 The year 2015 started with the preview-release of a new Javascript framework: Aurelia. Web developers are not really dhort of frameworks, but somehow nobody is fully satisfied with the offers. I decided to take a closer look.

Apr 2015 The topic of technical debt in software development comes up regularly in blog posts, podcasts or talks. I am highlighting some of the practical experiences in trying to reduce technical debt.
